intro: Jacobinia glabribracteata, commonly known as the smooth-bract jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
